title: Paris/8th arrondissement
name: Musée du Petit Palais
hours: Open daily except except Mondays and public holidays from 10am to 6pm. Thursdays until 8pm for temporary exhibitions only. Ticket office closes at 5 pm.
price: Free admission to the permanent collections. Admission charge for temporary exhibitions (€ 5-11)
content: The Petit Palais was built as a complement to the Grand Palais for the 1900 universal exhibition, and afterwards became the prime exhibition venue for the City of Paris' vast collection of artworks spanning centuries from ancient history to the 1800s. There is a permanent exhibition of selected artworks of artifacts, complemented by temporary exhibitions of historic artworks. The Petit Palais also features an on-site cafe/restaurant, as well as a book and gift shop.
